note: The first publication of the Morte was as Thus endeth thys noble and Ioyous book entitled le morte Darthur ([Westminister: Printed by William Caxton, 1485]; facsimile edi-
title: The Winchester Manuscript is shelved as London, British Library MS Additional 59678, written between 1470 and 1483 by two professional scribes and is notable for its use of red ink. The text itself had been written while Malory—a minor nobleman accused of many criminal acts—was a political prisoner in the Tower of London under King Edward IV between 1468 and 1470. Before the discovery of the Winchester Manuscript by a librarian at Winchester College in 1934, Malory’s work had only been transmitted through William Caxton’s 1485 printed edition. It is not known how Winchester College acquired the manuscript. For a facsimile edition, see The Winchester Malory: A Facsimile

note: is nonetheless an invaluable resource.
